result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant M Burnett II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryant M Burnett II in court.  
Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Bryant M Burnett II.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and a Global Offer  with case 22CF1570 and request time to review with the client.
Court will accept case 22cf1570 for purposes of a Global Resolution. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett II appeared by video.  Attorney Ashley Fard appeared by video for Bryant M Burnett II.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD ON BEHALF OF BR 19. 
Defendant Bryant M Burnett II in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Bryant M Burnett II.  Attorney Amy Spanczak appeared in court on behalf of Francesco Mineo for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State V Lee Hearing. Court advises parties that although today was calendared for a State V Lee hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Court sets next court date for a Preliminary Hearing before prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett II appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Case to be heard in Br. 16 for Br. 19 due to lower pending case.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a status. SPD hs not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATUS of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Defense to possibly retain private. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett in court with Attorney Jade Hall who appeared on behalf of Attorney Katherine Graber; they appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Graber who is Attorney of record is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:45 PM Defendant Bryant M Burnett in court in person with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present prior to the case being called. Defense needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Bryant M Burnett in court with attorney Jeffry R. Schwartz.  Defendant Bryant M Burnett in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryant M Burnett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defense counsel challenges probable cause which was then denied by the Court.
Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
